lines.text: It's Jim Rawlings - back from the grave
Guess again, Old Timer. My name's not Jim Rawlings and I'm not back from any grave
Do you, do you mean to tell me, you ain't Jim Rawlings of the Diamond R who disappeared five years ago?
Well that's what I'm telling ya. My name's Grant, Texas Grant. What's yours?
Oh, well the folks round here call me 'Hefty'. I don't know why. Maybe it's on account of my size
Well I wouldn't think that'd have anything to do with it
That's what I thought too
You're sure the spittin' image of Rawlings

Say listen you. Whatever your name is. You've imposed on this town long enough. And you been doing a lot of talking when you had a gun to back up your play. Now I'm sayin' something - this town ain't big enough to hold the two of us
Well then maybe you better be leaving, Becker
I ain't a-leavin'. I'm a-callin' your bluff.
Just how?
I'll be waitin' for ya in my saloon at four o'clock. Alone. And if you're a man, you'll meet me there. Alone.
I'll be there
I'll be a-waiting. And come a-shootin'!

[riding up quickly, dismounting, and confronting Grant]
I want to talk to you.
Well, Becker, too bad you weren't in time here for our little party
Don't worry. I've been havin' a little fun on my own.
If you've been havin' fun, it must have been costin' someone somethin'.
[Steve guffaws]

[to Texas]
You see, there's been some pretty bad cases of lead poisonin' around here - regular epidenic!
You, uh, haven't been able to find a doctor who can cure the trouble.
You can't cure dead men what's been shot in the back by a unknown killer. The best thing a fella can do is keep his mouth shut.

[to Texas Grant]
I don't care who you are, Honey, but i'm awfully glad you're here.

[after getting winged in the wrist by Grant]
I wasn't drawin' on you, Rollins. I was just lookin...
Yes, you were just goin' to shoot me in the back. Now you get your partner, and both of you clear out. I'll give you that much of a chance.
All right, Rollins, we ain't lookin' for no trouble.

[in a threatening tone]
If you are just come back to town, I'll be lookin' for yuh!
These rustlers got you buffaloed too?
Nope, they ain't. They ain't nobody got me buffaloed!
